result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin Lee Greenwood

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Calvin Lee Greenwood in court.  Attorney Tom Hayes in court for Calvin Lee Greenwood.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Case adjourned for sentencing. Conditions of bail remain in full force and effect pending sentencing. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Calvin Lee Greenwood in court.  Attorney Tom Hayes in court for Calvin Lee Greenwood.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Discussion held regarding case information discrepancy between State and Defense. Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No driving without a valid license.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/11/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Calvin Lee Greenwood in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge , Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/9/22 @ 2:30p
